Sentencas: A wet atomising system has been employed as a novel method to prepare ultrafine Gd-doped CeO2 (GDC) electrolyte slurries.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: By changing the fluid flow pressure and repeating the atomisation process several times for the same atomised slurries, we have obtained optimised ultrafine GDC slurry with high-dispersed and homogeneous distribution.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The sizes of the particles of GDC were in the range of tens of nanometres.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: A highly dense electrolyte layer (membrane) was prepared using the ultrafine GDC slurries for intermediate temperatures microtubular solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) applications.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: The SOFC was fabricated by using supporting porous anode tubes of NiO and GDC, and the cathode consisted of La0.6Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3-y and GDC.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications

Sentencas: A dense 10 pm GDC electrolyte layer was obtained at a lower sintering temperature of 1,250 degrees C for 1 h. The SOFC was tested with humidified (3% H2O) hydrogen as a fuel and the static air as an oxidant, and the tubular cell maintained its high performance even at 500 degrees C.
Titulo: Wet Atomisation of Gd-doped CeO2 Electrolyte Slurries for Intermediate Temperatures' Microtubular SOFC Applications
